data.title: No. 9 River Hawks face No. 13 Quinnipiac for home
data.meta_description: Friday, October 17th vs. No. 13 Quinnipiac (7:15pm; Tsongas Center; Lowell, Mass.)
data.text:
Men's Ice Hockey 10/16/2014 7:33:00 PM

No. 9 River Hawks face No. 13 Quinnipiac for home-and-home set

UMass Lowell hosts the Bobcats on Friday at 7:15pm from the Tsongas Center

Friday, October 17th vs. No. 13 Quinnipiac (7:15pm; Tsongas Center; Lowell, Mass.)

Game Notes | Watch Live ($) | Listen Live (Comm) | Listen Live (Non-Commercial) | Live Stats | Buy Tickets

Video Preview

PRIDE NIGHT

Follow on Twitter: @RiverHawkNation @RiverHawkHockey Tweet #UnitedInBlue

Saturday, October 18th at No. 13 Quinnipiac (7pm; High Point Solutions Arena, Hamden, Conn.)

Watch Live | Listen Live (Comm) | Listen Live (Non-Commercial) | Live Stats | Buy Tickets

Follow on Twitter: @RiverHawkNation @RiverHawkHockey Tweet #UnitedInBlue

Commercial Radio:

River Hawk Radio Network: (900AM, 1250AM, WCAP 980AM, WSMN 1590AM)

Talent: Bob Ellis (Play by Play); Jim Connelly (Analyst)

Non-Commericial Radio: WUML-FM 91.5:

Talent: Zack Tretheway (Play by Play); James Shirton (Analyst); Derek Dempsey (Engineer); Matt Denaro (Producer)

SCOUTING THE RIVER HAWKS: No. 9 ranked UMass Lowell enter's the weekend series with a 1-0-0 record after a 5-2 victory against then No. 4 Boston College in the season opener on Friday, October 10th at the Tsongas Center. Senior defenseman Zack Kamrass leads the team with two points (2a).The River Hawks have now been ranked in the Top 20 of the national polls for 43 straight weeks.

LAST TIME OUT: The River Hawks defeated Boston College in the season opener in front of 7,326 fans (second largest crowd in Tsongas Center history) and a record student crowd of 2,365. 10 different River Hawks scored a point and five different UMass Lowell players scored goals, including Robert Francis and Michael Louria's first collegiate goals. Junior transfer Kevin Boyle notched 19 saves (.905 save%) and got the win in his first appearance as a RiverHawk, becoming one of only five goalies that have accomplished this since 2000 (Brian Robbins, T.J. Massie, Jon Dryjowicz-Burek, Peter Vetri, John Yaros).

SCOUTING THE BOBCATS: Quinnipiac defeated Bentley, 5-3, in its 2014-15 season-opener at home on Oct. 11 at High Point Solutions Arena. The capacity crowd of 3,420 saw four different Bobcats score, led by Sam Anas' two-goal night, while Matthew Peca and Travis St. Denis added a goal and an assist each. Freshman Bo Pieper scored his first career goal, which was the first goal of the season for Quinnipiac, while Landon Smith dished out two assists. Quinnipiac is 13-12-3 against Hockey East teams since it joined the Division I ranks in 1998-99. Over the last three seasons, Quinnipiac is 8-1-3 against the Hockey East.

ALL-TIME SERIES VS. QUINNPIAC: The River Hawks are 1-2 all-time against Quinnipiac, including a pair of 3-1 losses last October in a home-and-home series. UMass Lowell's lone victory (4-1) against Quinnipiac came at the Tsongas Center on October 30, 2008. Kory Falite has two goals in the game and the victory was Blaise MacDonald's 200th career coaching win. Head Coach Norm Bazin is 0-2-0 all-time vs. the Bobcats.

RIVER HAWKS HOST PRIDE NIGHT ON FRIDAY: The UMass Lowell athletic department has partnered with the Office of Multicultural Affairs to bring fans the first-ever Pride Night on Friday night, which will serve as the culmination of a week of activities on campus as part of "Coming Out, Coming Together" week. In addition, UMass Lowell will debut its 2014-2015 "You Can Play Project" video, featuring athletes from all of its Division I rosters at the game. The You Can Play Project is dedicated to ensuring equality, respect and safety for all athletes, without regard to sexual orientation.

UMASS LOWELL 20-WIN SEASONS: The River Hawks registered their third consecutive 20-win season for the first time in their Division I history on February 14, 2014 vs. Massachusetts. It marked the 16th 20-win season in program history and the 11th at the Div. I level.

WEEKLY/MONTHLY AWARDS:

Zack Kamrass

HEA Defensive Player of the Week Oct. 6th

UMASS LOWELL IN THE RANKINGS: Here is a week-by-week look at the River Hawks in the national polls and the HE standings:

Date USAHM USCHO HEA

9/29 RV 17th 7th (pre)

10/6 RV 17th 7th (pre)

10/13 9th 9th T-1st

SUCCESS IS THE NORM: Norm Bazin is in his fourth season at UMass Lowell. He has compiled a 79-35-7 record (.681) in 121 games in three plus seasons for the River Hawks. He owns a 117-66-14 mark (.629) in 197 games in his career collegiate coaching record, which includes three seasons spent at Hamilton College. He recorded his 100th career coaching victory on Nov. 23 vs. Notre Dame at the Tsongas Center. Bazin is a two-time Hockey East Coach of the Year honoree and was named the 2013 Spencer Penrose Award Winner given annually by the American Hockey Coaches Association to the Division I Coach of the Year. Bazin has led the River Hawks to three straight NCAA tournament appearances, back-to-back Hockey East Tournament Championships (2013, 2014) and one Frozen Four appearance (2013).

HEAD COACH NORM BAZIN IN THE MEDIA: Coach Bazin and select players are available to the media every Tuesday at 4:45pm post-practice at the Tsongas Center and are available for one-on-one phone interviews as well. Please contact Pete Souris for more information. Listen to Coach Bazin live every Thursday afternoon on the Christian and King Show at 12:30pm on ESPN NH Radio (900AM).

THIS DAY IN UMASS LOWELL HOCKEY HISTORY:

October 17, 2003: Sophomore Ben Walter scores a pair of power-play goals, helping UMass Lowell deadlock Miami 4-4 in the first round of the Nye Tournament in Anchorage, Alaska. Lowell won a shootout to advance to the championship game

October 18, 2003: The UMass Lowell hockey team loses a 1-0 game for the first time in its 1,135-game history when the River Hawks are blanked by host Alaska-Anchorage in the championship game of the Nye Tournament in Anchorage, Alaska.

RIVERHAWKS ON THE TELEVISION: The River Hawks are scheduled to appear seven times on television in the regular-season. Here is a listing of games the River Hawks are scheduled to appear.

Date Matchup Time Channel

Sat., Oct. 10 vs. Boston College 7 p.m. NESN

Fri., Oct. 24 vs. Michigan 7 p.m. NESN

Fri., Oct. 31 at New Hampshire 7:30 p.m. WBIN-TV

Fri., Nov. 21 at Notre Dame 7:30 p.m. NBCSN

Sat., Dec. 6 vs. Maine 8 p.m. NBCSN

Fri., Jan. 23 vs. Providence 7 p.m. NESN

Fri., Jan. 30 at Merrimack 7 p.m. WBIN-TV

RIVERHAWKS ON THE RADIO: The River Hawks can be heard every week throughout the season on ESPN NH Radio (900AM) and (1250AM), as well as on the following local affiliates: WCAP (980AM) in Lowell and WSMN (1590AM) in Nashua, N.H. Bob Ellis (PxP) and Jimmy Connelly (Color Analyst) have the call of all River Hawk hockey games throughout the season. The game is accessible via the ESPN Radio app (http://espn.go.com/mobile/products/products?id=7451658). UMass Lowell home games are also available on WUML Radio (91.5 FM; non-commercial radio) with Zack Tretheway (PxP) and James Shirton (Color Analyst) broadcasting on campus and in the surrounding Lowell communities.
